Moreover, there are heavenly beings who are negligent and attached to pleasure, not cultivating the true Dharma but indulging in play. Although they dwell in the heavenly palace with the Bodhisattva, they do not go to pay homage or receive the Dharma, each thinking:
'Let us first enjoy pleasures, and tomorrow we will go to the Bodhisattva to receive the essential teachings.'

There are two causes and conditions for manifesting in this way:
First, in order to cause the devas to leave behind heedlessness.

There are also inferior sentient beings in the world who, due to having few wholesome roots, are unable to see the Buddha attain unsurpassed enlightenment and turn the wheel of the sublime Dharma. The bodhisattva manifests as an infant and as a prince playing in the inner palace for their sake.

The bodhisattva manifests ascetic practices for their sake;

There are also devas and humans who have long made vows:

The Great PrajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ SÅ«tra, Scroll 573 Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order Chapter 9: Attaining Nothing, Part 6, Chapter 9 At that time, in the assembly there was a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva named Good Thought, who asked Most Victorious:
